inlineContent.text: An enumeration that specifies the convolution type.
The descriptor of the input. The data type of the input must be
The descriptor of the weights. The data type of the weights must be
The descriptor of the output. The data type of the output must be
The padding, which is the number of virtual zeros added to the sides of each channel.
The activation function that the layer applies to the output.
The width and height increments of the input image.
The width and height increments between elements in the input image during convolution.
Convolution layers only support arrays with a data type of

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
An enumeration that acts as a namespace for Swift overlays to BNNS.
A layer object that wraps a convolution filter and manages its deinitialization.
Constants that describe convolution padding modes.
A constant that represents a 4D array of rotated convolution weights.
A constant that represents a 4D array of convolution weights.
A constant that represents a 4D array of packed convolution weights with 32-output channel packing and 128-byte array address alignment.
A constant that represents a 4D array of rotated convolution weights.
A constant that represents a 3D image stack.
A structure that contains common filter parameters.
A structure that describes the shape, stride, data type, and, optionally, the memory location of an n-dimensional array.
